commit_message:
Update the cache if we don't have a root device hint

Or at least try to.

Some deployments just don't use root device hints, and this is okay.

However, other deployments need root device hints, and with fast
track mode in ramdisks, we created a situation where the node cache
could be updated by a human or software between the time the agent
was started, and the deployment was requested.

As a result, the agent has been updated to check if we have a hint
and if we don't, update the cache from the node lookup endpoint.

This is not needed when the inband deploy steps are executed, as
the process of updating the steps does force the node cache to be
updated.

Change-Id: I27201319f31cdc01605a3c5ae9ef4b4218e4a3f6
Story: 2008039
Task: 40701
(cherry picked from commit d3c3d4dabe907ac9b6fc9eb95a6015564ed55d72)
(cherry picked from commit 4c9fbd07b0d3b9050e3d6a6419d732bfb912ad4e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/66/751866/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue with nodes undergoing fast-track from introspection to deployment where the agent internal cache of the node may be stale. In particular, this can be observed if node does not honor a root device hint which is saved to Ironic's API *after* the agent was started. More information can be found in `story 2008039 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008039>`_.

commit_message:
Update the cache if we don't have a root device hint

Or at least try to.

Some deployments just don't use root device hints, and this is okay.

However, other deployments need root device hints, and with fast
track mode in ramdisks, we created a situation where the node cache
could be updated by a human or software between the time the agent
was started, and the deployment was requested.

As a result, the agent has been updated to check if we have a hint
and if we don't, update the cache from the node lookup endpoint.

This is not needed when the inband deploy steps are executed, as
the process of updating the steps does force the node cache to be
updated.

Change-Id: I27201319f31cdc01605a3c5ae9ef4b4218e4a3f6
Story: 2008039
Task: 40701

commit_message:
Fix backup node lookup

The node lookup code added in change
I27201319f31cdc01605a3c5ae9ef4b4218e4a3f6
was slightly broken in that we call a method
with a keyword arguemnt which doesn't exist.

uuid versus node_uuid.

It happens, it is a quick fix!

Spotted on a metalsmith job:

[-] Agent is requesting to perform an explicit node cache update.
    This is to pickup any chanages in the cache before deployment.
[-] Failed to update node cache. Error lookup_node() got an
    unexpected keyword argument 'uuid'

Change-Id: I59ecec65707a2f03918b233f1925395ebe59b8c4
(cherry picked from commit 3426963552966af9feae2c79c7c53ee770a9523c)
(cherry picked from commit 6c696e6b7e7f1ef7cbe99a0c5f960b7dea358cf6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/64/751864/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes a minor incorrect keyword argument that was matching between the method caller and the unit test but not the actual method, unit test, and caller. This was a non-fatal issue, and should now permit the agent to attempt to lookup the node one last time before deploying the instance image to pick-up a root device hint.

commit_message:
Fix backup node lookup

The node lookup code added in change
I27201319f31cdc01605a3c5ae9ef4b4218e4a3f6
was slightly broken in that we call a method
with a keyword arguemnt which doesn't exist.

uuid versus node_uuid.

It happens, it is a quick fix!

Spotted on a metalsmith job:

[-] Agent is requesting to perform an explicit node cache update.
    This is to pickup any chanages in the cache before deployment.
[-] Failed to update node cache. Error lookup_node() got an
    unexpected keyword argument 'uuid'

Change-Id: I59ecec65707a2f03918b233f1925395ebe59b8c4

commit_message:
Proposing victoria RC1 for networking-generic-switch

As a courtesy for project teams, on RC1 week the release management
team proposes a RC1 release for all cycle-with-rc deliverables,
based on HEAD. That RC1 will double as the branch point for the
stable/victoria branch for networking-generic-switch.

Release liaison or PTL should +1 this proposal if they are happy
with it, amend this proposal (for example with a more recent SHA)
to match their needs, or -1 to block it until release-critical
issues are all fixed.

Change-Id: Id24776e9f1f3560d70fa0f2f2b3e81a8f53648d3
Signed-off-by: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>

commit_message:
Update the cache if we don't have a root device hint

Or at least try to.

Some deployments just don't use root device hints, and this is okay.

However, other deployments need root device hints, and with fast
track mode in ramdisks, we created a situation where the node cache
could be updated by a human or software between the time the agent
was started, and the deployment was requested.

As a result, the agent has been updated to check if we have a hint
and if we don't, update the cache from the node lookup endpoint.

This is not needed when the inband deploy steps are executed, as
the process of updating the steps does force the node cache to be
updated.

Change-Id: I27201319f31cdc01605a3c5ae9ef4b4218e4a3f6
Story: 2008039
Task: 40701
(cherry picked from commit d3c3d4dabe907ac9b6fc9eb95a6015564ed55d72)
(cherry picked from commit 4c9fbd07b0d3b9050e3d6a6419d732bfb912ad4e)
(cherry picked from commit 9718a18dedc21ed9316dc28e495db3a30be8c062)

added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue with nodes undergoing fast-track from introspection to deployment where the agent internal cache of the node may be stale. In particular, this can be observed if node does not honor a root device hint which is saved to Ironic's API *after* the agent was started. More information can be found in `story 2008039 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008039>`_.

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix issues with share server migration

This patch is a follow up patch of the main change[1] that adds
support for share server migration in NetApp driver.
It fixes two issues:
- Data motion 'get_backend_configuration' now avoids sending vserver
  configuration, available only in DHSS=False mode, when driver is
  configured with DHSS=True.
- After migrating a share server, all volumes appears with different
  autosize configuration and need to be manually updated to the
  original values. Provisioning options are also being updated in the
  same method.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747048/

Change-Id: I28a47417ec5dda0ed1f6c64fae37f5af6ca057e6
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/05/753405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
bifrost-cli: do not provide any release if non can be detected

We update defaults on each stable branch to match its release, so
if no release can be detected, let's not provide 'master'.

Change-Id: I01009307a066b6c60a97959764c31b5e7624708e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/58/752658/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os.path import shutil import tempfile from unittest import mock from bifrost import cli from bifrost.tests import base FILE_NO_BRANCH = """ [gerrit] host=review.opendev.org port=29418 project=openstack/bifrost.git """ FILE_WITH_BRANCH = """ [gerrit] host=review.opendev.org port=29418 project=openstack/bifrost.git defaultbranch=stable/banana """ class TestGetRelease(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super().setUp() self.temp_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp() self.addCleanup(lambda: shutil.rmtree(self.temp_dir)) def test_provided(self): self.assertEqual('stable/ussuri', cli.get_release('ussuri')) self.assertEqual('stable/ussuri', cli.get_release('stable/ussuri')) self.assertEqual('master', cli.get_release('master')) @mock.patch.object(cli, 'BASE', '/non/existing/dir') def test_no_file(self): self.assertIsNone(cli.get_release(None)) def test_from_file_no_branch(self): with open(os.path.join(self.temp_dir, '.gitreview'), 'wt') as fp: fp.write(FILE_NO_BRANCH) with mock.patch.object(cli, 'BASE', self.temp_dir): self.assertIsNone(cli.get_release(None)) def test_from_file_with_branch(self): with open(os.path.join(self.temp_dir, '.gitreview'), 'wt') as fp: fp.write(FILE_WITH_BRANCH) with mock.patch.object(cli, 'BASE', self.temp_dir): self.assertEqual('stable/banana', cli.get_release(None))

commit_message:
Proposing victoria RC1 for networking-baremetal

As a courtesy for project teams, on RC1 week the release management
team proposes a RC1 release for all cycle-with-rc deliverables,
based on HEAD. That RC1 will double as the branch point for the
stable/victoria branch for networking-baremetal.

Release liaison or PTL should +1 this proposal if they are happy
with it, amend this proposal (for example with a more recent SHA)
to match their needs, or -1 to block it until release-critical
issues are all fixed.

Change-Id: Ia95b1d4c160a6440d54378d6abb95e235d150ec4
Signed-off-by: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>

subject: Update SKS Keyserver URLs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-23 16:29:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ossa/commit/ed8c4da7aec694f855345e7414d6ee44f84af78a', 'message': "Update SKS Keyserver URLs

The HKPS proxy on 443/tcp at sks-keyservers.net hasn't been operable
for many months (consistently returning a 502 Bad Gateway error).
Switch to a direct HKP URL on 11371/tcp at pool.sks-keyservers.net
instead, which returns the same content (unfortunately not over an
encrypted connection). The next best alternatives would be to use a
lookup on keyserver.ubuntu.com which misses a lot of the
cross-signing key info, or keys.openpgp.net which only provides a
link to download key material with no additional information and no
signatures.

Change-Id: I5d99bcb261a77e2d557fa31ca199f2eed09583c3
"}]
commit_message:
Update SKS Keyserver URLs

The HKPS proxy on 443/tcp at sks-keyservers.net hasn't been operable
for many months (consistently returning a 502 Bad Gateway error).
Switch to a direct HKP URL on 11371/tcp at pool.sks-keyservers.net
instead, which returns the same content (unfortunately not over an
encrypted connection). The next best alternatives would be to use a
lookup on keyserver.ubuntu.com which misses a lot of the
cross-signing key info, or keys.openpgp.net which only provides a
link to download key material with no additional information and no
signatures.

Change-Id: I5d99bcb261a77e2d557fa31ca199f2eed09583c3

commit_message:
Update scripts-library.sh to grab output when command exists

This patch updates scripts-library.sh to only grab output from btrfs,
nspawn, and iptables when the commands exist in order to aid in
the troubleshooting of (real) failures.

Change-Id: I5c8677d3e8d1e1c6a6486654d532a899b5d0cf29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/55/698055/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "$(which iptables)" ]; then (iptables -vnL && iptables -t nat -vnL && iptables -t mangle -vnL) > \ "/openstack/log/instance-info/host_firewall_info_${TS}.log" || true fi systemctl status ${i} >>/dev/null 2>&1 if [ $? = 0 ]; then systemctl status ${i} > "/openstack/log/instance-info/${i}_${TS}.log" || true journalctl -u ${i} >> "/openstack/log/instance-info/${i}_${TS}.log" || true fi if [ "$(which btrfs)" ]; then btrfs filesystem usage /var/lib/${dir_name} > \ "/openstack/log/instance-info/btrfs_${dir_name}_usage_${TS}.log" || true btrfs filesystem show /var/lib/${dir_name} > \ "/openstack/log/instance-info/btrfs_${dir_name}_show_${TS}.log" || true btrfs filesystem df /var/lib/${dir_name} > \ "/openstack/log/instance-info/btrfs_${dir_name}_df_${TS}.log" || true btrfs qgroup show --human-readable -pcre --iec /var/lib/${dir_name} > \ "/openstack/log/instance-info/btrfs_${dir_name}_quotas_${TS}.log" || true fi

subject: Define condition for the first play host one time
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-14 13:04:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_magnum/commit/589b6926c8188d75e8ecb9a2688e8d50c6068433', 'message': 'Define condition for the first play host one time

We use the same condition, which defines against what host some "service"
tasks should run against, several times. It's hard to keep it the same
across the role and ansible spending additional resources to evaluate
it each time, so it's simpler and better for the maintenance to set
a boolean variable which will say for all tasks, that we want to run

commit_message:
Define condition for the first play host one time

We use the same condition, which defines against what host some "service"
tasks should run against, several times. It's hard to keep it the same
across the role and ansible spending additional resources to evaluate
it each time, so it's simpler and better for the maintenance to set
a boolean variable which will say for all tasks, that we want to run
only against signle host, if they should run or not now.

Change-Id: Idd1c6c9ad7f5165b8e12e156ab6398b28c5e799a

commit_message:
Delete image when volume driver is not initialized

When volume driver is not initialized, the image service will be
none, so image will still remain in the glance DB.
This patch fix this.

Change-Id: Ida9aae8f29fbb399efb246140598d02ceef230cb

commit_message:
backup, ceph: Use subprocess from eventlet

The ceph backup driver uses the subprocess module to orchestrate rbd
export and import. The normal python module is going to stall greenlets
for the backup duration.

Change-Id: Iac940e2630424830602f4526cf2666e6721504e6
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>

commit_message:
POC: idrac redfish bios?

Just an idea to spur some discussion, since redfish endpoints
don't, afaik, support being posted to on iDRAC bmcs, because a
configuration job must be submitted instead.

Change-Id: I7d0023634275669cc85b0463e9e4ed960e4f0bea

commit_message:
Isolating backup tests

Their appears to be a persistent problem with backup
tests notifier causing multiple gate failures.
We've mocked all leaking notifications but the issue
stays.
This is an attempt to solve it by isolating the backup
tests that calls the notifier using oslo_concurrency's
lockutils module for thread lock and python fixtures
for setup and cleanup.

Change-Id: I87d5ddb6268c89fb9c7462983a92a2df4ce0851f
Closes-Bug: #1803648

commit_message:
Remove oslo.versionedobjects extra install

We had a very old line in our test-requirements to install
oslo.versionedobjects with its [fixtures] extra to pick up additional
test requirements. That extra was removed with
e44431cff6b76d33e8da1812c31069a1075a97a7 several releases ago. Our
installs would silently ignore this, but with the upcoming pip resolver
changes, this will now cause an error installing dependencies.

Change-Id: I6bb5378377dba19cae119ebb3c146732a8b3844c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
volume: Introduce extend attached encrypted volume tests

This change introduces an extend attached encrypted volume test
specifically using the LUKSv1 encryption format after issues were
discovered in bug #1861071. The test mostly reuses the existing test for
extending attached unencrypted volumes with some specific encryption
related logic being introduced in BaseVolumeAdminTest.

Note that while attached volume extension is not an admin only operation
the creation of the encrypted volume type is, resulting in this test
being labelled as an admin test.

A ``[compute-feature-enabled]/extend_attached_encrypted_volume``
configurable is also introduced to control when this test is ran.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706900
Related-Bug: #1861071
Change-Id: Ibf864c608656d0af906bf0859cedf9cd70b3e58f

commit_message:
[Glusterfs] Fix delete share, mount point not disconnected

When we delete the shared instance, in addition to erasing the data
in the share, we should disconnect the client's mount point to
prevent the data from being written in.

Closes-Bug: #1886010
Change-Id: I7a334fb895669cc807a288e6aefe62154a89a7e4
(cherry picked from commit 9d44ba0b6a2d20be6158ff667ff3b81de31f5cad)

commit_message:
Allow configuring IPMI cipher suite

Negotiation fails for some hardware, let's allow an explicit setting.

Change-Id: I04a3391f85412dcabc6105bd91beb1da25bdfc19
(cherry picked from commit 2773c5fb257f06226409e1f40c7820d98e3839ae)
(cherry picked from commit ac2d4c086b3130a95c0316a750ab374818b5ae1b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/10/752710/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Allows configuring IPMI cipher suite via the new ``driver_info`` parameter ``ipmi_cipher_suite`` to enable operators to navigate ``ipmitool`` behavior changes around supported ciphers. issues: - Some ``ipmitool`` builds, in particular on machines running Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2, have changed the default cipher suite being offered which can cause ``ipmitool`` to completely fail to negotiate a connection with the BMC. Operators who encounter this situation should use the ``ipmi_cipher_suite`` parameter in the ``driver_info`` field to override and directly assert the required cipher. Because of potential security implications of attempting second level auto-negotiation and known BMC vendor behaviors, this must be identified by the operator and explicitly set as logic to attempt to navigate through situations like this may have undesirable results.

commit_message:
Ceph Multibackend changes

1. Tempest has an option CONF.compute.compute_volume_common_az to make
sure that Volume and Instance are created in common AZ If Availability
zones are used. The paramater is respected when instance is created
because tempest.common.compute.create_test_server() is used but not
respected when volume is created for test purpose. Let's make sure
AZ is set when volume is created if parameter is set.

2. The plain Encryptor provider is not support on ceph backends, the
test test_encrypted_cinder_volumes_cryptsetup fails on:
cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Volume driver reported an error:
Provider plain not supported.
This comes from [1] which is called in [2]. The Plain provider will be deprecated
in future completely.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/branch/master/cinder/volume/volume_utils.py#L1195
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/branch/master/cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py#L877

Change-Id: Ib6290ed1ad5779e4e6fed449f3335dbdada42f0d

commit_message:
Clear cached facts based on the tag as well

Facts gathering comes next after clearing the cached ones. Facts
will be gathered if --tags facts was specified. But cached facts get
cleared always, even w/o that tag.

In DCN deployments that may bring errors that can be avoided with
ansible-playbook-command.sh --tags facts. That is because fact caching
needs to be updated when running outside of the overcloud.

Fix this inconsistency so that the facts never cleared nor gathered
until the facts tag has been used explicitly.

Change-Id: I0ef544a18ec868321ebf51a99051b1ed982cd677
Related-bug: #1896620
Related-bug: #1884654
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create interface to create mysql resources via hieradata

This added the "tripleo::<service name>::mysql_user" interface, which
allows folks to create databases, users and grants via hieradata instead
of having to modify puppet-tripleo.

Change-Id: I975d64c73e314159db0f6c1ada14a26491a46d1a

commit_message:
Proposing victoria RC1 for searchlight

As a courtesy for project teams, on RC1 week the release management
team proposes a RC1 release for all cycle-with-rc deliverables,
based on HEAD. That RC1 will double as the branch point for the
stable/victoria branch for searchlight.

Release liaison or PTL should +1 this proposal if they are happy
with it, amend this proposal (for example with a more recent SHA)
to match their needs, or -1 to block it until release-critical
issues are all fixed.

commit_message:
Workaround issue with >= 16.5 when requiring `addressable/uri`

A change made in 16.5 causes an issue when trying to require `addressable/uri`.
This has been filed upstream with this issue [1]. As a workaround, it seems
using `autoload` fixes the problem.

[1] https://github.com/chef/chef/issues/10452

Change-Id: I8cb5de8aed76f3530e4b4b475024e554c8451790
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/753415
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

added_lines: # TODO(ramereth): Workaround for this issue https://github.com/chef/chef/issues/10452 # require 'addressable/uri' autoload :Addressable, 'addressable/uri'

commit_message:
Workaround issue with >= 16.5 when requiring `addressable/uri`

A change made in 16.5 causes an issue when trying to require `addressable/uri`.
This has been filed upstream with this issue [1]. As a workaround, it seems
using `autoload` fixes the problem.

[1] https://github.com/chef/chef/issues/10452

Change-Id: Iae337a8ff1784c46e8171fc54eb00ef28f11561a
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/753102
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

commit_message:
backup, ceph: do not set ceph backups to incremental

The ceph backup driver uses ceph's internal snapshot mechanism for doing
incremental backups. This type of incremental backup is more an
implementation detail than something that should be exposed to the
outside, because it makes handling of the backups harder.

By forcing backups to incremental, if an earlier backup exists, you can
only clean up old backups by deleting all backups, effectively giving up
the safety of backups, and restarting all over again.

The exported and imported diff results in a fully usable rbd image,
which effectively resembles base backup semantics, in the target cluster
and ceph has no problem deleting snapshots that are in the middle of the
snapshots history. By forcing all ceph backups to be full backups in
cinder, we can leverage this to enable easier backup management.

This change effectively flips the logic from change
I22deff68d9376c2ecc88bd2d9d0e1b445d793123

Change-Id: I570245fe59680a9dcbb8baa82963d59b5da25f83
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/82/625582/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._backup_rbd(backup, volume_file, volume.name, length) # Even though we might have done an ceph incremental backup, force the # backup to be treated as a full backup. For the ceph incremental # backup, the delta export and import results in a full usable rbd # image, based on snapshots. We can delete snapshots between other # snaphots, which isn't possible with a classic incremental backup. # For the non-ceph case we're always performing a full backup, without # any delta logic. updates = {'parent_id': None}
deleted_lines: # We update the parent_id here. The from_snap is of the format: # backup.BACKUP_ID.snap.TIMESTAMP. So we need to extract the # backup_id of the parent only from from_snap and set it as # parent_id if from_snap: parent_id = from_snap.split('.') updates = {'parent_id': parent_id[1]} return updates updates = {} updates = self._backup_rbd(backup, volume_file, volume.name, length) # If updates is empty then set parent_id to None. This will # take care if --incremental flag is used in CLI but a full # backup is performed instead if not updates and backup.parent_id: updates = {'parent_id': None}

Add rbd_data_pool

Add a configuration option to specify the RBD data pool
It can be used to RBD data and metadata in different storage tiers.

commit_message:
New snapshot_clone_size option

snapshot_clone_size defines the size of the LV snapshot. Useful when
the available disk space on the storage node is limited.

Change-Id: Id5d187f526759f299bfced487376afeddee2cd42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/91/615091/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_snapshot(self, snapshot, snapshot_clone_size=None): if snapshot_clone_size is None: snapshot_clone_size = CONF.snapshot_clone_size self.configuration.lvm_type, snapshot_clone_size)

commit_message:
Huawei driver refactor

Huawei driver code is badly decayed and hard to keep maintaining.
This patch implements the Huawei driver refactor, which to make
the code much more clear, reliable and maintainable.

Change-Id: Iffd47554f5bad6088f76b53fb58e3d5711de5a5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/26/514126/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2017 Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import ipaddress import json import six import sys from oslo_log import log as logging import taskflow.engines from taskflow.patterns import linear_flow from taskflow import task from taskflow.types import failure from cinder import exception from cinder.i18n import _ from cinder.volume import utils as volume_utils from cinder.volume.drivers.huawei import constants from cinder.volume.drivers.huawei import huawei_utils from cinder.volume.drivers.huawei import hypermetro from cinder.volume.drivers.huawei import replication from cinder.volume.drivers.huawei import smartx LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class NamedTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): name_postfix = kwargs.pop('name_postfix', None) super(NamedTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) if name_postfix: self.name = '%s.%s' % (self.name, name_postfix) class CreateLunCheckTask(task.Task): default_provides = {'opts'} def execute(self, volume, feature_support): opts = huawei_utils.get_volume_params(volume) if opts['hypermetro'] and opts['replication_enabled']: msg = _("Hypermetro and replication cannot be " "specified at the same time.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) feature_pairs = (('qos', 'SmartQoS'), ('smartcache', 'SmartCache'), ('smartpartition', 'SmartPartition'), ('hypermetro', 'HyperMetro'), ('replication_enabled', 'HyperReplication'), ) for feature in feature_pairs: if opts[feature[0]] and not feature_support[feature[1]]: msg = _("Huawei storage doesn't support %s.") % feature[1] LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) return {'opts': opts} class CreateLunTask(task.Task): default_provides = {'lun_id', 'lun_wwn', 'lun_params'} def __init__(self, client, configuration, *args, **kwargs): super(CreateLunTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.client = client self.configuration = configuration def execute(self, volume, opts): pool_name = volume_utils.extract_host(volume.host, level='pool') pool_id = self.client.get_pool_id(pool_name) if not pool_id: msg = _("Pool %s doesn't exist in storage.") % pool_name LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) params = { 'NAME': huawei_utils.encode_name(volume.id), 'PARENTID': pool_id, 'DESCRIPTION': volume.name, 'ALLOCTYPE': opts.get('LUNType', self.configuration.lun_type), 'CAPACITY': int(volume.size) * constants.CAPACITY_UNIT, 'WRITEPOLICY': self.configuration.lun_write_type, 'PREFETCHPOLICY': self.configuration.lun_prefetch_type, 'PREFETCHVALUE': self.configuration.lun_prefetch_value, 'DATATRANSFERPOLICY': opts['policy'], } lun = self.client.create_lun(params) return {'lun_id': lun['ID'], 'lun_wwn': lun['WWN'], 'lun_params': params} def revert(self, result, **kwargs): if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): return self.client.delete_lun(result['lun_id']) class WaitLunOnlineTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(WaitLunOnlineTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.client = client def execute(self, lun_id): huawei_utils.wait_lun_online(self.client, lun_id) class AddQoSTask(task.Task): default_provides = {'qos_id'} def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(AddQoSTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.smartqos = smartx.SmartQos(client) def execute(self, lun_id, opts): if not opts['qos']: qos_id = None else: qos_id = self.smartqos.add(opts['qos'], lun_id) return {'qos_id': qos_id} def revert(self, result, lun_id, **kwargs): if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): return if result['qos_id']: self.smartqos.remove(result['qos_id'], lun_id) class AddCacheTask(task.Task): default_provides = {'cache_id'} def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(AddCacheTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.smartcache = smartx.SmartCache(client) def execute(self, lun_id, opts): if not opts['smartcache'] or not opts['cachename']: cache_id = None else: cache_id = self.smartcache.add(opts['cachename'], lun_id) return {'cache_id': cache_id} def revert(self, result, lun_id, **kwargs): if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): return if result['cache_id']: self.smartcache.remove(result['cache_id'], lun_id) class AddPartitionTask(task.Task): default_provides = {'partition_id'} def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(AddPartitionTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.smartpartition = smartx.SmartPartition(client) def execute(self, lun_id, opts): if not opts['smartpartition'] or not opts['partitionname']: partition_id = None else: partition_id = self.smartpartition.add(opts['partitionname'], lun_id) return {'partition_id': partition_id} def revert(self, result, lun_id, **kwargs): if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): return if result['partition_id']: self.smartpartition.remove(result['partition_id'], lun_id) class CreateHyperMetroTask(task.Task): default_provides = {'hypermetro_id'} def __init__(self, local_cli, remote_cli, config, *args, **kwargs): super(CreateHyperMetroTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.hypermetro = hypermetro.HuaweiHyperMetro( local_cli, remote_cli, config) def execute(self, volume, lun_id, lun_params, opts): if not opts['hypermetro']: hypermetro_id = None else: hypermetro_id = self.hypermetro.create_hypermetro( lun_id, lun_params) if volume.group_id: self.hypermetro.add_hypermetro_to_group( volume.group_id, hypermetro_id) return {'hypermetro_id': hypermetro_id} def revert(self, result, volume, **kwargs): if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): return if result['hypermetro_id']: self.hypermetro.delete_hypermetro(volume, result['hypermetro_id']) class CreateReplicationTask(task.Task): default_provides = {'replication_id'} def __init__(self, local_cli, remote_cli, config, *args, **kwargs): super(CreateReplicationTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.replication = replication.ReplicationManager( local_cli, remote_cli, config) def execute(self, volume, lun_id, lun_params, opts): if not opts['replication_enabled'] or not opts['replication_type']: pair_id = None else: pair_id = self.replication.create_replica( lun_id, lun_params, opts['replication_type']) if volume.group_id: self.replication.add_replication_to_group( volume.group_id, pair_id) return {'replication_id': pair_id} def revert(self, result, **kwargs): if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): return if result['replication_id']: self.replication.delete_replica(result['replication_id']) class CheckLunExistTask(task.Task): default_provides = {'lun_info', 'lun_id'} def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(CheckLunExistTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.client = client def execute(self, volume): lun_info = huawei_utils.get_lun_info(self.client, volume) if not lun_info: msg = _("Volume %s does not exist.") % volume.id LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) metadata = huawei_utils.get_volume_private_data(volume) lun_wwn = metadata.get('huawei_lun_wwn') if lun_wwn and lun_wwn != lun_info['WWN']: msg = _("LUN %s does not exist.") % lun_wwn LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) return {'lun_info': lun_info, 'lun_id': lun_info['ID']} class CheckLunMappedTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(CheckLunMappedTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.client = client def execute(self, lun_info): if lun_info.get('EXPOSEDTOINITIATOR') == 'true': msg = _("LUN %s has been mapped to host.") % lun_info['ID'] LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) class DeleteHyperMetroTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, local_cli, remote_cli, config, *args, **kwargs): super(DeleteHyperMetroTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.hypermetro = hypermetro.HuaweiHyperMetro( local_cli, remote_cli, config) def execute(self, volume): self.hypermetro.delete_hypermetro(volume) class DeleteReplicationTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, local_cli, remote_cli, config, *args, **kwargs): super(DeleteReplicationTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.replication = replication.ReplicationManager( local_cli, remote_cli, config) def execute(self, volume): data = huawei_utils.to_dict(volume.replication_driver_data) if 'pair_id' in data: self.replication.delete_replica(data['pair_id']) class DeleteQoSTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(DeleteQoSTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.smartqos = smartx.SmartQos(client) def execute(self, lun_info): qos_id = lun_info.get('IOCLASSID') if qos_id: self.smartqos.remove(qos_id, lun_info['ID']) class DeleteCacheTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(DeleteCacheTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.smartcache = smartx.SmartCache(client) def execute(self, lun_info): cache_id = lun_info.get('SMARTCACHEPARTITIONID') if cache_id: self.smartcache.remove(cache_id, lun_info['ID']) class DeletePartitionTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(DeletePartitionTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.smartpartition = smartx.SmartPartition(client) def execute(self, lun_info): partition_id = lun_info.get('CACHEPARTITIONID') if partition_id: self.smartpartition.remove(partition_id, lun_info['ID']) class DeleteLunTask(task.Task): def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(DeleteLunTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.client = client def execute(self, lun_id): self.client.delete_lun(lun_id) class CreateMigratedLunTask(task.Task): default_provides = {'tgt_lun_id', 'lun_params'} def __init__(self, client, *args, **kwargs): super(CreateMigratedLunTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.client = client def execute(self, host, lun_info, feature_support, lun_type=None): if not feature_support['SmartMigration']: msg = _("Huawei storage doesn't support SmartMigration.") lun_info['ALLOCTYPE'], 'CAPACITY': lun_info['CAPACITY'], 'WRITEPOLICY': lun_info['WRITEPOLICY'], 'PREFETCHPOLICY': lun_info['PREFETCHPOLICY'], 'PREFETCHVALUE': lun_info['PREFETCHVALUE'], 'OWNINGCONTROLLER': lun_info['OWNINGCONTROLLER'], } if 'DATATRANSFERPOLICY' in lun_info: lun_params['DATATRANSFERPOLICY'] = lun_info['DATATRANSFERPOLICY'] lun = self.client.create_lun(lun_params) json.loads(lun_info['REMOTEREPLICATIONIDS']) return True if ids else False def _check_lun_in_splitmirror(self, lun_info): ids = None if 'SPLITMIRRORIDS' in lun_info: ids = json.loads(lun_info['SPLITMIRRORIDS']) return True if ids else False def _check_lun_in_luncopy(self, lun_info): ids = None if 'LUNCOPYIDS' in lun_info: ids = json.loads(lun_info['LUNCOPYIDS']) return True if ids else False def _check_lun_in_migration(self, lun_info): return lun_info.get('LUNMigrationOrigin') in ('0', '1') def _check_lun_is_common(self, lun_info): return (lun_info.get('MIRRORTYPE') != '0' or lun_info.get('SUBTYPE') != '0') def execute(self): lun_info = self._get_external_lun() for i in dir(self): if callable(getattr(self, i)) and i.startswith('_check_'): func = getattr(self, i) kwargs['name_postfix'] = loc_rmt kwargs['provides'] = ( loc_rmt + '_target_ips', loc_rmt + '_target_iqns', loc_rmt + '_target_eths', loc_rmt + '_chap_info', loc_rmt + '_alua_type') super(GetISCSIConnectionTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.client = client self.iscsi_info = iscsi_info self.iscsi_default_target_ip = iscsi_default_target_ip def _get_config_target_ips(self, initiator): target_ips = [] for ini in self.iscsi_info: if ini['Name'] == initiator and ini.get('TargetIP'): target_ips = [ip.strip() for ip in ini['TargetIP'].split(';') if ip.strip()] break if not target_ips: target_ips = self.iscsi_default_target_ip return target_ips def _get_port_ip(self, port_id): iqn_info = port_id.split(',', 1)[0] return iqn_info.split(':', 5)[5] def _get_port_iqn(self, port_id): iqn_info = port_id.split(',', 1)[0] return iqn_info.split('+')[1] def _get_chap_info(self, initiator): chap_config = None for ini in self.iscsi_info: if ini['Name'] == initiator and 'CHAPinfo' in ini: chap_config = ini['CHAPinfo'] break chap_name, chap_password = None, None if not chap_config: ini_info = self.client.get_iscsi_initiator_info(initiator) if ini_info and ini['Name'] == initiator and 'ALUA' in ini: return ini['ALUA'] def execute(self, connector): initiator = connector['initiator'] ip_iqn_map = {} target_ports = self.client.get_iscsi_tgt_ports() for port in target_ports: ip = self._get_port_ip(port['ID']) normalized_ip = ipaddress.ip_address(six.text_type(ip)).exploded ip_iqn_map[normalized_ip] = (port['ID'], port['ETHPORTID']) config_ips = self._get_config_target_ips(initiator) LOG.info('Configured iscsi ips %s.', config_ips) target_ips = [] target_iqns = [] target_eths = [] for ip in config_ips: ip_addr = ipaddress.ip_address(six.text_type(ip)) normalized_ip = ip_addr.exploded if normalized_ip in ip_iqn_map: if ip_addr.version == 6: target_ips.append('[' + ip_addr.compressed + ']') else: target_ips.append(ip_addr.compressed) iqn = self._get_port_iqn(ip_iqn_map[normalized_ip][0]) target_iqns.append(iqn) target_eths.append(ip_iqn_map[normalized_ip][1]) if not target_ips or not LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) chap_info = self._get_chap_info(initiator) alua_type = self._get_alua_type(initiator) LOG.info('Get iscsi target_ips: %(target_ips)s, ' 'target_iqns: %(target_iqns)s, ' 'target_eths: %(target_eths)s, ' 'chap_info: %(chap_info)s, ' 'alua_type: %(alua_type)s.', {'target_ips': target_ips, 'target_iqns': target_iqns, 'target_eths': target_eths, 'chap_info': chap_info, 'alua_type': alua_type} ) return target_ips, target_iqns, target_eths, chap_info, alua_type class CreateHostTask(NamedTask): default_provides = {'host_id'} def GetFCConnectionTask(NamedTask): def __init__(self, client, fc_san, loc_rmt, *args, **kwargs): kwargs['name_postfix'] = loc_rmt kwargs['provides'] = loc_rmt + '_ini_tgt_map' super(GetFCConnectionTask, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.client = client self.fc_san = fc_san def _get_online_fc_ports(self): port_map = {} contr_map = {} fc_ports = self.client.get_fc_ports() for port in fc_ports: if port['RUNNINGSTATUS'] == constants.FC_PORT_CONNECTED: location = port['PARENTID'].split('.') port_info = {'id': port['ID'], 'bandwidth': port['RUNSPEED'], 'contr': location[0], 'wwn': port['WWN']} port_map[port['WWN']] = port_info if location[0] not in contr_map: contr_map[location[0]] = [port_info] else: contr_map[location[0]].append(port_info) return port_map, contr_map def _get_fabric(self, ini_port_wwns, tgt_port_wwns): ini_tgt_map = self.fc_san.get_device_mapping_from_network( ini_port_wwns, tgt_port_wwns) def _filter_not_connected_fabric(fabric_name, fabric): ini_port_wwn_list = fabric.get('initiator_port_wwn_list') tgt_port_wwn_list = fabric.get('target_port_wwn_list') if not ini_port_wwn_list or not tgt_port_wwn_list: LOG.warning("Fabric %(fabric_name)s doesn't really " "connect host and array: %(fabric)s.", {'fabric_name': fabric_name, 'fabric': fabric}) return None return ini_port_wwn_list, tgt_port_wwn_list valid_fabrics = [] for fabric in ini_tgt_map: ini_tgt_tuple = _filter_not_connected_fabric( fabric, ini_tgt_map[fabric]) if ini_tgt_tuple: valid_fabrics.append(ini_tgt_tuple) if not valid_fabrics: msg = _("No valid fabric connection: %s.") % ini_tgt_map LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) LOG.info("Got fabric: %s.", valid_fabrics) return valid_fabrics def _get_fabric_contrs(self, fabric_ports, contr_map, exist_wwns): new_wwns = set(fabric_ports) - set(exist_wwns) fabric_contrs = {} for k in contr_map: fabric_contrs[k] = [port for port in contr_map[k] if port['wwn'] in new_wwns] return fabric_contrs def _count_port_weight(self, port): portgroup_ids = self.client.get_portgroup_by_port_id(port['id']) if not portgroup_ids: return sys.float_info.max mapped_count = 0 for pg_id in portgroup_ids: mappingview_ids = self.client.get_mappingview_by_portgroup_id( pg_id) if not mappingview_ids: continue lungroup_id = self.client.get_lungroup_in_mappingview( mappingview_ids[0]) mapped_count += self.client.get_lun_count_of_lungroup(lungroup_id) mapped_count += self.client.get_snapshot_count_of_lungroup( lungroup_id) return float(port['bandwidth']) / mapped_count def _select_ports_per_contr(self, ports): port_weights = [] for port in ports: weight = self._count_port_weight(port) port_weights.append((weight, port)) sorted_weight_pairs = sorted(port_weights, key=lambda d: d[0], reverse=True) return [pair[1] for pair in sorted_weight_pairs[:constants.PORT_NUM_PER_CONTR]] def _get_weighted_ports(self, fabric_contrs): weighted_ports = [] for k in fabric_contrs: if len(fabric_contrs[k]) <= 2: weighted_ports.extend(fabric_contrs[k]) else: select_ports = self._select_ports_per_contr(fabric_contrs[k]) weighted_ports.extend(select_ports) return weighted_ports def _get_fc_zone(self, wwns, host_id): port_map, contr_map = self._get_online_fc_ports() fabrics = self._get_fabric(wwns, list(port_map.keys())) portgroup_name = constants.PORTGROUP_PREFIX + host_id portgroup = self.client.get_portgroup_by_name(portgroup_name) if portgroup: exist_wwns = self.client.get_fc_port_wwns_in_portgroup( portgroup['ID']) else: exist_wwns = [] ini_tgt_map = {} for fabric in fabrics: fabric_contrs = self._get_fabric_contrs( fabric[1], contr_map, exist_wwns) weighted_ports = self._get_weighted_ports(fabric_contrs) for ini in fabric[0]: ini_tgt_map[ini] = exist_wwns + [i['wwn'] for i in weighted_ports] return ini_tgt_map def _get_fc_link(self, wwns, host_id): host_initiators = self.client.get_host_fc_initiators(host_id) free_initiators = self.client.get_online_free_fc_initiator() invalid_wwns = set(wwns) - set(host_initiators) - set(free_initiators) if invalid_wwns: msg = _("There are invalid initiators %s.") % invalid_wwns LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) ini_tgt_map = {} for wwn in wwns: tgt_wwns = self.client.get_fc_target_wwpns(wwn) if wwn not in ini_tgt_map: ini_tgt_map[wwn] = tgt_wwns else: ini_tgt_map[wwn].append(tgt_wwns) return ini_tgt_map def execute(self, connector, host_id): wwns = map(lambda x: x.lower(), connector['wwpns']) if self.fc_san: ini_tgt_map = self._get_fc_zone(wwns, host_id) else: ini_tgt_map = self._get_fc_link(wwns, host_id) if not ini_tgt_map: msg = _('No fc connection for wwns %s.') % wwns LOG.error(msg) raise commit_message:
Adds peer persistence feature to HPE 3PAR driver

First attempt at a naive implementation for Peer Persistence volumes in the
HPE 3PAR driver for Cinder.

This is a cleaned-up version of a patch we are currently using on a
standalone Cinder installation (non-OpenStack). This means that the basic
functionality of being able to create cinder volumes with peer persistence
has been validated. However, a multitude of tests will be required in order
to merge this functionality upstream.

A first attempt at listing the tests to be executed:

- Validation of the "replication:peer_persistence" setting
- Double-check implementation/configuration of peerpersistent volumes
- Validate creation of peerpersistent volumes when one 3PAR instance is
  unavailable
- Validate automatic fail-over of an existing peerpersistent volume when
  a 3PAR instance goes offline
- Validate manual fail-over of a peerpersistent volumes
- Evaluate retype functionality for peerpersistent volumes

Change-Id: Ib17949da132749bbc4fc3ea56e7b497b3fd94127
Implements: blueprint cinder-hpe3par-peer-persistence
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/18/611318/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EXTRA_SPEC_REP_PEERPERSISTENCE = "replication:peer_persistence" DEFAULT_REP_PEERPERSISTENCE = False replication_peer_persistence = extra_specs.get( self.EXTRA_SPEC_REP_PEERPERSISTENCE, self.DEFAULT_REP_PEERPERSISTENCE) if replication_peer_persistence: # 'sync_targets_peer' added to enable Peer Persistence on these volumes sync_targets_peer = [] # define peer-persistent volume objects if replication_peer_persistence: sync_target_peer = {'targetName': target['backend_id'], 'policies': { 'autoRecover': True, 'autoFailover': True, 'pathManagement': True}} sync_targets_peer.append(sync_target_peer) # If peer persistence is enabled, add the necessary options if replication_peer_persistence: opt = {'targets': sync_targets_peer} try: self.client.modifyRemoteCopyGroup(rcg_name, opt) except Exception as ex: msg = (_("There was an error setting the peer persistence for " "the remote copy group: %s.") % six.text_type(ex)) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg)

Adds peer persistence feature to HPE 3PAR driver

First attempt at a naive implementation for Peer Persistence volumes in the
HPE 3PAR driver for Cinder.

This is a cleaned-up version of a patch we are currently using on a
standalone Cinder installation (non-OpenStack). This means that the basic
functionality of being able to create cinder volumes with peer persistence
has been validated. However, a multitude of tests will be required in order
to merge this functionality upstream.

A first attempt at listing the tests to be executed:

- Validation of the "replication:peer_persistence" setting
- Double-check implementation/configuration of peerpersistent volumes
- Validate creation of peerpersistent volumes when one 3PAR instance is
  unavailable
- Validate automatic fail-over of an existing peerpersistent volume when
  a 3PAR instance goes offline
- Validate manual fail-over of a peerpersistent volumes
- Evaluate retype functionality for peerpersistent volumes

Changed:

- Fixed invalid variable name
- Resolved all Flake8 warnings

Implements: blueprint cinder-hpe3par-peer-persistence

commit_message:
Adds peer persistence feature to HPE 3PAR driver

First attempt at a naive implementation for Peer Persistence volumes in the
HPE 3PAR driver for Cinder.

This is a cleaned-up version of a patch we are currently using on a
standalone Cinder installation (non-OpenStack). This means that the basic
functionality of being able to create cinder volumes with peer persistence
has been validated. However, a multitude of tests will be required in order
to merge this functionality upstream.

A first attempt at listing the tests to be executed:

- Validation of the "replication:peer_persistence" setting
- Double-check implementation/configuration of peerpersistent volumes
- Validate creation of peerpersistent volumes when one 3PAR instance is
  unavailable
- Validate automatic fail-over of an existing peerpersistent volume when
  a 3PAR instance goes offline
- Validate manual fail-over of a peerpersistent volumes
- Evaluate retype functionality for peerpersistent volumes

Changed:

- Fixed invalid variable name
- Resolved all Flake8 warnings
- Fixed one invalid if-clause when replication is not enabled

Implements: blueprint cinder-hpe3par-peer-persistence

subject: Fix: make Intel CNA hardware manager none generic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-15 11:56:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/56b272a6add8ddd9ac6be59d2782a2f3864849d4', 'message': 'Fix: make Intel CNA hardware manager none generic

Currently, InterlCnaHardwareManager inherits GenericHardwareManager
which makes it a new "GenericHardwareManager" with "MAINLINE" priority.
This causes all other hardware-managers with lower priority than
"MAINLINE" never be used. To fix this, make InterlCnaHardwareManager
inherit basic HardwareManager.

Change-Id: I28b665d8841b0b2e83b132e1f25df95e03e7ba10
Story: 2008142

commit_message:
Fix: make Intel CNA hardware manager none generic

Currently, IntelCnaHardwareManager inherits GenericHardwareManager
which makes it a new "GenericHardwareManager" with "MAINLINE" priority.
This causes all other hardware-managers with lower priority than
"MAINLINE" never be used. To fix this, make IntelCnaHardwareManager
inherit basic HardwareManager.

Change-Id: I28b665d8841b0b2e83b132e1f25df95e03e7ba10
Story: 2008142
Task: 40882

commit_message:
Added Backup driver for MooseFS
features:
 - Added backend driver for MooseFS (MooseFSPro) storage.

Change-Id: I75a91f837da1a73155c04add2dce454c39950265
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/52/572752/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Red Hat, Inc. # Copyright (c) 2018 Tappest sp. z o.o. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """Implementation of a backup service that uses MooseFS or MooseFSPro as the backend. """ import os import stat from os_brick.remotefs import remotefs as remotefs_brick from oslo_concurrency import processutils as putils from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from cinder.backup.drivers import posix from cinder import exception from cinder import interface from cinder import utils moosefsbackup_service_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('moosefs_backup_mount_point', default='$state_path/backup_mount', help='.'), cfg.StrOpt('moosefs_backup_share', help='MooseFS share in ' '<hostname|ipv4addr>:<mfssubfolder> format. ' 'Eg: mfsmaster:/backups'), cfg.StrOpt('moosefs_backup_mount_options', help=('Mount options passed to the MooseFS (MooseFSPro) client.' 'See mfsmount -h for help.')), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(moosefsbackup_service_opts) LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @interface.backupdriver class MoosefsBackupDriver(posix.PosixBackupDriver): """Provides backup, restore and delete using MooseFS or MooseFSPro.""" def __init__(self, context, db=None): self.backup_mount_point_base = CONF.moosefs_backup_mount_point self.backup_share = CONF.moosefs_backup_share self.mount_options = CONF.moosefs_backup_mount_options self._execute = putils.execute self._root_helper = utils.get_root_helper() backup_path = self._init_backup_repo_path() super(MoosefsBackupDriver, self).__init__(context, backup_path=backup_path) def check_for_setup_error(self): """Raises error if any required configuration flag is missing.""" required_flags = ['moosefs_backup_share'] for flag in required_flags: val = getattr(CONF, flag, None) if not val: raise exception.InvalidConfigurationValue(option=flag, value=val) def _init_backup_repo_path(self): LOG.info('mount_options: %s', self.mount_options) remotefsclient = remotefs_brick.MooseFSRemoteFsClient( 'moosefs', self._root_helper, moosefs_mount_point_base=self.backup_mount_point_base, moosefs_mount_options=self.mount_options) remotefsclient.mount(self.backup_share) mount_path = remotefsclient.get_mount_point(self.backup_share) group_id = os.getegid() current_group_id = utils.get_file_gid(mount_path) current_mode = utils.get_file_mode(mount_path) if group_id != current_group_id: cmd = ['chgrp', group_id, mount_path] self._execute(*cmd, root_helper=self._root_helper, run_as_root=True) if not (current_mode & stat.S_IWGRP): cmd = ['chmod', 'g+w', mount_path] self._execute(*cmd, root_helper=self._root_helper, run_as_root=True) return mount_path def get_backup_driver(context): return MoosefsBackupDriver(context)

commit_message:
Don't update volume_id in backup manager when import backup

When importing, we will update the new created backup with
old volume id. In fact, we need to keep the volume_id attribute
set empty (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000) in order to
avoid confusing.

Change-Id: I30f8188796bc0e0d744109c116c71ce1477fc14f
Closes-Bug: #1780386

commit_message:
Option needed to create volume in erasure coded ceph pool

Erasure coded pools for rbd have been supported since the ceph
luminous release. To use this feature the erasure coded pool where
the data will be held needs to be specified during volume creation.
The rbd_pool option still needs to point to a replicated pool where
a small amount of metadata will be stored in OMAP. Currently the
driver implicitly uses the default value of None.

Change-Id: I3128d3f82cdc09531a33d3b3dd27b624b907236e
Closes-Bug: 1779691

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-20 03:04:38.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/39c57f0ee751f26825561505a7fbff81b241b9e7', 'message': "Group model: ensure 'volume_types' are mapped to VolumeTypes

If 'volume_types' for expected_attrs is being used, volume_types
returned is actually mapped to the GroupVolumeTypeMapping
model rather than the VolumeTypes model. This corresponds
to the following staticmethod Group._from_db_object in cinder/objects/group.py:

  if 'volume_types' in expected_attrs:
      volume_types = base.obj_make_list(
          context, objects.VolumeTypeList(context),
          objects.VolumeType,
          db_group['volume_types'])

This change ensures that the 'volume_types' member of Group object is
correctly mapped to VolumeTypes. We implemented it using primaryjoin
and secondaryjoin arguments of sqlalchemy.orm.relationship to define
a column in Group model.

Closes-Bug: #1756867

"}]
commit_message:
Group model: ensure 'volume_types' are mapped to VolumeTypes

If 'volume_types' for expected_attrs is being used, volume_types
returned is actually mapped to the GroupVolumeTypeMapping
model rather than the VolumeTypes model. This corresponds
to the following staticmethod Group._from_db_object in cinder/objects/group.py:

  if 'volume_types' in expected_attrs:
      volume_types = base.obj_make_list(
          context, objects.VolumeTypeList(context),
          objects.VolumeType,
          db_group['volume_types'])

This change ensures that the 'volume_types' member of Group object is
correctly mapped to VolumeTypes. We implemented it using primaryjoin
and secondaryjoin arguments of sqlalchemy.orm.relationship to define
a column in Group model.

Closes-Bug: #1756867

Change-Id: I51d98b4c479a995f9758b10389864d258f95ef1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/29/554229/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: volume_types = relationship(VolumeTypes, secondary='group_volume_type_mapping', primaryjoin='and_(' 'GroupVolumeTypeMapping.group_id == Group.id,' 'GroupVolumeTypeMapping.deleted == 0,' 'Group.deleted == 0)', secondaryjoin='and_(' 'GroupVolumeTypeMapping.volume_type_id == VolumeTypes.id,' 'VolumeTypes.deleted == 0)', backref='groups')

commit_message:
Get pools API doesn't reflect capacity change

Cinder will update pool's capacity attributes
when creating new resource, but the get-pools API
doesn't reflect these changes. This patch try to
fix this by updating capabilities from attributes.

Change-Id: Idb1b85575fc2c8be7e6d0707cc5f2a931a1d0fbd
Closes-Bug: #1748696
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/05/543205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_latest_capabilities(self): if not self.capabilities: return {} capabilities = dict(self.capabilities) # NOTE(tommylikehu): We need update the capabilities with # pools's attributes since we could update the usage between # two periodic update tasks when creating new resources. if self.updated and self.updated >capabilities['timestamp']: for key, value in capabilities.items(): if hasattr(self, key): capabilities[key] = getattr(self, key) return capabilities new_pool.update(dict(capabilities= pool.get_latest_capabilities())) return [dict(name=key, capabilities=value.get_latest_capabilities())

commit_message:
Support EventAlarming description in TOSCA

This patch supports new tosca policy
"tosca.policies.tacker.EventAlarming"

* Add this new policy section to definition yaml
* Support read and translate this new policy section
* Support multiple type polices, such as using
  "tosca.policies.tacker.EventAlarming" and
  "tosca.policies.tacker.Alarming" in 1 VNF.

Note:
This feature is supposed to be used from the VNF creation
using the API '/vnfs', which is a legacy features based on NFV-IFA.
Support for API '/vnflcm' based on the latest NFV-SOL is T.B.D.

Implements: bp/add-event-alarm-policy
Change-Id: Ifcc40adfa4f0dd7cecb4d4ab3cb79e9032a934f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/58/746358/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if policy.type_definition.is_derived_from( constants.POLICY_EVENT_ALARMING): continue

commit_message:
Add image id compare

If the image has been updated on disk, the podman_container isn't
rebuild to use the new container.  This change adds an image id check to
the image check to see if the image name and tag are the same but the id
of the image has changed. It should be noted that the podman_container
does not fetch the updated image as it simply checks if it exists. A
user needs to use podman_image with force: True prior to running
podman_container to hit this condition.

Change-Id: Icb718d1c1ea9b829a532c37844ffb3c8b5db5dbe
Related-Bug: #1895974

added_lines: # the image in the config has changed (e.g. new tag) if self._diff_update_and_compare('image', before, after) return True # compare image id on disk to container to see if the image has been updated before = self.info['image'] after = self.image_info['id'] return self._diff_update_and_compare('image_id', before, after)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Fix type of public_net_allocation_pools

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733598/ added support
of allocation_pools, but set type of public_net_allocation_pools
to comma_delimited_list which causes below issue because for
comma_delimited_list, list items are converted to string:-

Property error: : resources.public_subnet.properties.allocation_pools[0]:
"{'end': '10.0.0.199', 'start': '10.0.0.128'}" is not a map

We need to use type: json to get it work, this patch fixes it.

Related-Bug: #1874418
Change-Id: Iaebb297e5018ce8db6dd1f67a308e7707117fe03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal refs/changes/63/753563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Documentation for Share Migration Ocata Improvements.

Implemented several improvements to share migration in documentation
according to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/406305/

Summary of changes:

 - Add driver-assisted mandatory parameters.
 - Removed previous API documentation because support for them isn't
   there anymore after the backwards incompatible changes were
   made via https://review.opendev.org/#/c/406305/.
 - Add force-host-assisted migration.

Change-Id: I6d446b4037a3a9991e375f0a8bfb1f6edce09c1f
Closes-Bug: #1658230
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/90/715290/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Documentation is now available for API microversion 2.29 for share migration. upgrade: - Add all share migration driver-assisted mandatory parameters such as 'preserve_snapshot', 'preserve_metadata', 'nondisruptive', 'writable'. - Removed 'force-host-copy' and 'notify' parameters. deprecations: - Support for the experimental share migration APIs has been dropped for API microversion prior to 2.29 in the documentation.

commit_message:
Update lower-constraints versions

This updates lower constraints to versions that will work with py38 so
that when we move to running on focal nodes, which has py38 as its
default py3 runtime, the lower-constraints job will continue to pass.

It also cleans out some secondary requirements that are no longer needed
due to our direct dependencies being updated.

Linters are removed that are kept in the global requirements blacklist
as those are not version tracked and are not relevant for our
lower-constraints unit test runs.

Change-Id: Id7c84958bee19d24e2088fb9cce8522fdafd1c15
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update lower-constraints versions

This updates lower constraints to versions that will work with py38 so
that when we move to running on focal nodes, which has py38 as its
default py3 runtime, the lower-constraints job will continue to pass.

It also cleans out some secondary requirements that are no longer needed
due to our direct dependencies being updated.

Linters are removed that are kept in the global requirements blacklist
as those are not version tracked and are not relevant for our
lower-constraints unit test runs.

Change-Id: I6add044c00cb39d23d72df575a96e5367f67d26d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6ad6fd1c3d0b3c9172cb7953cc50f8ad8f4bf9de

commit_message:
Fix CA file for API client

If a custom CA file is configured via OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT, currently
communication with Keystone will fail, since the session is not created
using this CA file.

This change fixes the issue by passing the path to the CA file to the
keystoneauth session constructor.

Change-Id: Iad1bdea97ed649cc3c8f042dc5dd147b989dfd0e
Closes-Bug: #1873736

commit_message:
Remove Barbican installation from gates

Apparently Barbican is Octavia requirements only if we're doing TLS
offload on the LB. As we're just doing HTTPS passthrough it shouldn't be
required for our use case and should be safe to remove.

Change-Id: Ic2f6297691cd6bfe9def6d5d6ba0dea24579bfcc

commit_message:
Make the MTU attribute not nullable

This patch sets the MTU attribute to non-nullable, the code
that get the MTU and update the network in some methods can
be removed. If the MTU is empty before the pike version, it
is set to the default value of 1500.

Change-Id: Id4d738dde7fa4b7caccabad0aac542b82b4d7af1
Closes-Bug: #1842261

commit_message:
Proposing victoria RC1 for zaqar

As a courtesy for project teams, on RC1 week the release management
team proposes a RC1 release for all cycle-with-rc deliverables,
based on HEAD. That RC1 will double as the branch point for the
stable/victoria branch for zaqar.

Release liaison or PTL should +1 this proposal if they are happy
with it, amend this proposal (for example with a more recent SHA)
to match their needs, or -1 to block it until release-critical
issues are all fixed.

Change-Id: Iced4332675752413526f47aa4dabc487d6c32b1b
Signed-off-by: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>

subject: Fix redfish BIOS to use @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-18 04:08:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/f92d39908616f870e4e062ef9eba9047f0df650c', 'message': "Fix redfish BIOS to use @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime

This change fixes the 'redfish' BIOS interface implementation's
apply_configuration cleaning/deploy step to interoperate with Redfish
Services that enable a client to indicate when to apply settings via the
Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) Redfish standard
@Redfish.SettingsApplyTime annotation. [1]

Such services, typically offered by baseboard management controllers
(BMC), may require POST of the annotation, along with the future
intended state of the settings. Otherwise, they may never be applied.
That applies to the Dell EMC integrated Dell Remote Access Controller
(iDRAC).

When the annotation is not supported, it is not POST.

[1] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.11.0.html#settings-resource

Co-Authored-By: Eric Barrera <eric_barrera@dell.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aija Jauntva <aija.jaunteva@dell.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mike Raineri <mraineri@gmail.com>
Story: 2008163
Task: 40913
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750020/
Change-Id: I28a948f306b40c36b12e6f786e1e43a61e84a0f2
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-09-20 21:26:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/2c9d60a4c130848b5e10e3284e1c7d5f6ade546e', 'message': "Fix redfish BIOS to use @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime

This change fixes the 'redfish' BIOS interface 'apply_configuration'
cleaning/deploy step to work with Redfish Services that must be supplied
the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) Redfish standard
@Redfish.SettingsApplyTime annotation [1] to specify when to apply the
requested settings, such as the Dell EMC integrated Dell Remote Acesss
Controller (iDRAC).

Such services, typically offered by baseboard management controllers
(BMC), require POST of the annotation, along with the future intended
state of the settings. Otherwise, they may never be applied.

When the annotation is not supported, it is not POST.

[1] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.11.0.html#settings-resource

Co-Authored-By: Eric Barrera <eric_barrera@dell.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aija Jauntva <aija.jaunteva@dell.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mike Raineri <mraineri@gmail.com>
Story: 2008163

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750020/
Change-Id: I28a948f306b40c36b12e6f786e1e43a61e84a0f2
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2020-09-21 13:53:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/62263ea40ef08e66f6af62037b7679c9a593d15a', 'message': "Fix redfish BIOS to use @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime

This change fixes the 'redfish' BIOS interface 'apply_configuration'
cleaning/deploy step to work with Redfish Services that must be supplied
the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) Redfish standard
@Redfish.SettingsApplyTime annotation [1] to specify when to apply the
requested settings, such as the Dell EMC integrated Dell Remote Acesss
Controller (iDRAC).

Such services, typically offered by baseboard management controllers
(BMC), require POST of the annotation, along with the future intended
state of the settings. Otherwise, they may never be applied.

When the annotation is not supported, it is not provided with the future
intended state of the settings.

[1] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.11.0.html#settings-resource

Co-Authored-By: Eric Barrera <eric_barrera@dell.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aija Jauntva <aija.jaunteva@dell.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mike Raineri <mraineri@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix redfish BIOS to use @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime

This change fixes the 'redfish' BIOS interface 'apply_configuration'
cleaning/deploy step to work with Redfish Services that must be supplied
the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) Redfish standard
@Redfish.SettingsApplyTime annotation [1] to specify when to apply the
requested settings, such as the Dell EMC integrated Dell Remote Acesss
Controller (iDRAC).

Such services, typically offered by baseboard management controllers
(BMC), require POST of the annotation, along with the future intended
state of the settings. Otherwise, they may never be applied.

When the annotation is not supported, it is not provided with the future
intended state of the settings.

[1] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.11.0.html#settings-resource

Co-Authored-By: Eric Barrera <eric_barrera@dell.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aija Jauntva <aija.jaunteva@dell.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mike Raineri <mraineri@gmail.com>
Story: 2008163
Task: 40913
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750020/
Change-Id: I28a948f306b40c36b12e6f786e1e43a61e84a0f2

commit_message:
Followup Remove haproxy_check_script for UDP-only

The original patch: Ib2a80afb9223da2c0af6f6add250ffaaa20a316f

First attempt at fixing this issue assumed that the update function
would actually be called again after the initial LB creation, which it
is not. We should ensure that this is called when we do any UDP listener
creation, so the file can be removed if necessary.

Change-Id: Iec1ec7df420e3746b47004c8c0374d2d8274f45b

commit_message:
Add `pmem_namespaces` parameter

This change adds parameter `libvirt/pmem_namespaces` that
configure persistent memory(pmem) namespaces for Nova.

Conflicts:
      spec/classes/nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb

Resolved conflict which occured due to change
If5155db8635ad73ea1900a0143367802b9b159e8

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I96d7d6853f7c8748d0a72f8999595a889f421596
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing refs/changes/99/753599/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use UUID for mounted SwiftRawDisks

When SwiftRawDisks is set, try to mount the disks using uuids instead of
paths. This makes mounts more stable, eg. if a kernel gets updates and
device orders are changed.

This patch will also update existing entries in /etc/fstab and replaces
the device path with the corresponding UUID.

Change-Id: I275b962447015e804638ccf85c63a22d1bb6e3d6
(cherry picked from commit 6206d195928e11de4672404720e137422d619cad)

commit_message:
Fix broken gate

Zuul jobs  ovn-octavia-provider-functional-release and
ovn-octavia-provider-functional-master are broken because
of a "sudden" regression on test_integration.py after
it passed the gate and merged.

This issue still needs to be resolved and have the test
re-instated.

Partial-Bug: #1877447
Change-Id: I5fd12fe28349d5bf0b8ff4ebcfa8b301ba2b708b

subject: [Queens Only] Add rhos-release build parameter for UC in FFU
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-22 17:00:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/07169baf6b47781b1057cbb41aaec4bdde385649', 'message': "[Queens Only] Add rhos-release parameters for UC RHEL/build in FFU

When upgrading the Undercloud in the FFU procedure a sequential
upgrade is carried out. If using rhos-release, the very same
target RHEL version will be configured for the three releases
as the default takes ansible_distribution_version, which as we
come from an OSP10 Undercloud will point to 7.7. Also, the build
will, by default, be 'latest' which can be problematic.

Using the very same RHEL version for the three sequential upgrades
is a problem when getting to the most recent OSP13 build which is
based on RHEL 7.9.

This patch extends the ffu_undercloud_repo_args to include the
appropriate default parameters needed for rhos-release and sets
them for the role execution.

This is queens-only due to this whole mechanism being different in
later branches.

Change-Id: Ib763e2350724022d71750f53b39d2652c9853a3c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-09-22 19:00:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/22188954056be03e5068c9088229aa6b9883288b', 'message': "[Queens Only] Add rhos-release parameters for UC RHEL/build in FFU

commit_message:
[Queens Only] Add rhos-release build parameter for UC in FFU

When upgrading the Undercloud in the FFU procedure a sequential
upgrade is carried out. If using rhos-release, the 'latest'
build is used by default, which is not what we want.

This patch extends the ffu_undercloud_repo_args to include the
appropriate default parameters needed for rhos-release and sets
them for the role execution.

This is queens-only due to this whole mechanism being different in
later branches.

Change-Id: Ib763e2350724022d71750f53b39d2652c9853a3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/08/753408/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rhos_release: 11: build: "latest_cdn" rhel: "7.7" 12: build: "latest_cdn" rhel: "7.7" 13: build: "passed_phase2" rhel: "7.9"

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints for py27 env

py27 jobs are failing due to incompatible python
dependencies, use upper constraints to fix it.

Use constraints for last py2 release i.e train.

Also use stable/train branch for openstack/requirements.

commit_message:
Remove duplicate top call in containers

podman/docker top $container does the same as running 'top'
inside the containers, so let's drop the dup.
Change-Id: I40c5782ab0e690cfde78d06d19d58dbcac480081

subject: test_evacuate.sh: Stop using libvirt-bin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-22 09:30:05.000000000', 'files': ['gate/test_evacuate.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5ab9b28161291047b8de2cc9c27edc87b319a7bc', 'message': 'test_evacuate.sh: Stop using libvirt-bin

I49dc963ada17a595232d3eb329d94632d07b874b missed that
call_hook_if_defined will actually cause the entire run to fail [1] if
we attempt to stop the non-existent libvirt-bin service so just remove
it now we are using the train UCA.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/src/commit/7a70f559c559e22b498d735b4ed20aadc71b7f39/functions.sh#L74

Change-Id: Ife26f1ceb6208e12328ccdccbab0681ee55d5a2a
'}]
commit_message:
test_evacuate.sh: Stop using libvirt-bin

I49dc963ada17a595232d3eb329d94632d07b874b missed that
call_hook_if_defined will actually cause the entire run to fail [1] if
we attempt to stop the non-existent libvirt-bin service so just remove
it now we are using the train UCA.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/src/commit/7a70f559c559e22b498d735b4ed20aadc71b7f39/functions.sh#L74

Change-Id: Ife26f1ceb6208e12328ccdccbab0681ee55d5a2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/753267/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: sudo systemctl stop libvirt-binsudo systemctl start libvirt-bin

commit_message:
Fix tempest workspace initialization

Logic for renaming existing workspaces needs to be changed. It
raises an error when it tries to init an existing workspace name.

This change renames all existing workspaces so that workspace init
can run successfully.

Change-Id: I735695cc1107721d48bd0c30eb3a68b762da5b0d
Closes-Bug: #1896126
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/71/752571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # rename all existing workspaces ws=`tempest -q workspace list -f value | egrep -v "INFO" | cut -d " " -f1` for w in $ws; do tempest workspace rename --old-name $w --new-name ${w}_old done
deleted_lines: # (guilhermesp) We are adding this conditional here to avoid # breakage when we are upgrade from rocky to stein as the workspace # path has been change between these two releases if tempest workspace list | grep ' workspace '; then if ! tempest workspace list | grep ' workspace ' | grep -w {{ tempest_workspace }}; then # Init not working on existing entry. Renme old workspace instead and init new. export CURDATE=$(date +"%d%^b%g_%H%M%S%Z") tempest workspace rename --old-name workspace --new-name workspace_${CURDATE} tempest init {{ tempest_workspace }} fi fi exit 3 register: tempest_init_workspace changed_when: tempest_init_workspace.rc == 3 failed_when: - tempest_init_workspace.rc != 0 - tempest_init_workspace.rc != 3

commit_message:
Get the CIDR of the neutron port for NetworkConfig

Since GroupVars moved to overcloud.j2.yaml in
https://review.opendev.org/677218 the CIDR set in
'{{network.name_lower}}_cidr' in groupvars is limited
to one of the subnets on the network.

When a network have multiple subnets with different
subnet prefixes, this becomes a problem as nodes are
configured with the from subnet mask.

This change moves them to AnsibleHostVars.

Closes-Bug: #1895899
Change-Id: I4e4e5b1195d17f59c825a3f7df73920921e1f86e
(cherry picked from commit cd53ae79c79650c4ad1e774dad0bce60a3078c69)
